metadata.titel_preek: The New Temple, The New Life (Sermon 163)

kernfrasen: we are the temple of the living God
erecting the temple but not yet dedicating it
we demolish and cart away... we make improvements
God’s laborers, still working on the construction
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: THE BELIEVER IS A BUILDING UNDER CONSTRUCTION

kernfrasen: desires of the flesh war against the Spirit
O death, where is your strength in battle?
song of conquerors, not of combatants
soldier called out in the heat of battle
Heal me, Lord, for my bones are rattled
divine Physician was saying... I know how large this tumor would grow
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS A DISEASE AND GOD IS A SURGEON

kernfrasen: canceled the title to our captivity

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Widen your hearts... so as not to drag the same burden

cognitieve_implicaties: Love is a liquid poured in
Sin is a constriction of the self
theologische_implicaties: Grace requires human 'widening' (cooperation) but God provides the power to widen.
ethische_implicaties: The believer must actively seek to 'open up' to others.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Suggests God is limited by the 'size' of the human heart.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the physical sensation of pressure and expansion.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the 'Temple' as a macro-structure (Theology of the Body) and nests the Military and Medical metaphors within the 'construction phase' of that building.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The believer is simultaneously a soldier fighting an external enemy and a passive patient on an operating table.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Soldiers need strength/agency; patients need anesthesia/passivity.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The 'dedication' of the building is linked to the 'ransom' payment; the building cannot be dedicated until the title deed is cleared.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-animates the 'Temple' metaphor by focusing on the gritty details of construction (demolishing, carting away debris).
sterktes.voorbeeld: On the one hand, we demolish and cart away; and on the other, we make improvements.

risicos.beschrijving: The 'serpent's venom' metaphor for pride risks making sin a biological inevitability rather than a moral choice.
risicos.voorbeeld: counter-poison, distilled (so to speak) from the serpent himself
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view sin as a 'virus' they caught rather than a 'work' they do.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A construction site of a grand cathedral during a time of war.

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly moving; bridges the 'old' world and 'new' world.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing God's expertise over the 'patient/building's' complaints.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the dedication of a physical church building.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in 'Metaphor Stacking.' It moves from the Architectural (structural identity) to the Military (daily struggle) to the Medical (inner healing). The dominant landscape is one of 'Process'—nothing is finished yet, which provides great pastoral comfort for those struggling with sin.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Connect the 'ransom' more closely to the 'demolition' of the old building.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The blood of Christ is the currency that buys the land back from the slumlord of sin.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Frame the 'Physician' as a 'Combat Medic' who treats the soldier so they can return to the line.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Buildings don't have agency in their own construction.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize the 'laborers' aspect to maintain human responsibility.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To soften the 'hard' edges of stone and steel with the 'organic' growth of the Spirit.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound use of CMT to bridge the gap between the 'already' of Christ's victory and the 'not yet' of the believer's experience.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT reveals that the 'Temple' isn't just a pretty image; it's a cognitive map for understanding why we still sin after baptism.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the 'event' of the sermon, CMT shows the 'architecture' of the underlying thought system.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies the 'Verticality' schema (ascending to heaven) as the resolution to the 'Container' schema (being trapped in the body of death).

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses 'Schema Disruption' by taking the 'Law' (usually seen as a guide) and re-mapping it as a 'Barrier' or 'Power of Sin' to force the hearer toward Grace.
